thread.title: Set sail on second-ever MasterChef Caribbean cruise T
thread.title_full: Set sail on second-ever MasterChef Caribbean cruise | International | Travel | T

author: torontosun.com
title: Set sail on second-ever MasterChef Caribbean cruise T
text:
'MasterChef' and 'MasterChef Junior' contestants will return to the high seas as sailing dates for the second-ever MasterChef cruise have been revealed.
Fans of the popular TV cooking competition -- starring chefs Gordon Ramsay, Graham Elliot and Christina Tosi -- will want to beat the pressure cooker and book tickets now for the seven-day Caribbean cruise.
Holland America Line's Nieuw Amsterdam will host the MasterChef cruise and will set sail from Fort Lauderdale, Fla. on Nov. 6, 2016. The ship will dock in Turks and Caicos, Puerto Rico, St. Maarten and Half Moon Cay, Holland America's own private isle in the Bahamas, before returning to Florida on Nov. 13.
'MasterChef' season four winner Luca Manfe, season five runner-up Elizabeth Cauvel and 'MasterChef Junior' season two contestant Sean Le are all scheduled to be aboard. The winner of the current season of 'MasterChef' is also expected to join the cruise.
On-board programming will include:
- MasterChef Junior All-Stars Grilled Cheese Showdown: The best young home cooks add their own flair to this classic dish.
- Meet-and-Greet: Meet MasterChef and MasterChef Juniors all-stars.
- Mystery Box Challenge : Watch a live Mystery Box challenge as MasterChef all-stars compete to create a dish of their choice.
- All-Stars Finale Cook-Off: MasterChef and MasterChef Junior all-stars battle to become the next MasterChef cruise champion.
Rates for the cruise start at $1,398 per person. The first 100 travellers to make a qualified booking on the cruise will receive special access to the First 100 All-Star Soiree. For more details, visit masterchefcruise.com .
Have you ever gone on a theme cruise?
